title: How to Take a Soil Test | From the Ground Up

tasks.task: Conduct a soil test for a garden
subtasks: Determine if the garden needs a boost in spring
Gather necessary tools: trowel, screwdriver, clean bucket, bag for sample
Collect soil samples by digging with trowel to six inches depth
Use screwdriver to scrape thin strips of soil down center of trowel
Collect samples from ten different garden areas
Mix all samples in a bucket and take about two cups to a bag
Fill out laboratory form with soil analysis type and intended garden use
Consult local county Extension office for soil testing and interpretation advice
